entry.title: Block’s Cash App Bitcoin Revenue Drops 25% Year-Over-Year
entry.summary: Block's Cash App business Bitcoin revenue amounted to $35 million last quarter, a 25% drop compared to the same period in 2021.

entry.title: Australia’s Finance Regulator Opens Targeted Review Into Binance
entry.summary: Crypto exchange Binance closed 500 user positions yesterday after noting an error in how customers were classified.

entry.title: Never-Before-Seen 'Snow Crash' Manuscript Heads to Auction
entry.summary: Sotheby's will take bids on the rare copy of the novel that first coined the term “metaverse,” expecting to draw bids up to $60,000.

entry.title: Dapper Labs CEO Confirms Another Round of Layoffs
entry.summary: The move comes less than four months after the company cut 22% of its staff.

entry.title: Colombia Just Held a Court Hearing in the Metaverse—Cartoon Avatars and All
entry.summary: At least one country has found Zuckerberg’s tech useful.

entry.title: Fed Increases Focus on Crypto, Alerts Banks to Liquidity Risk
entry.summary: Unrelenting interest in cryptocurrency prompts a new warning from the Federal Reserve and other agencies.

entry.title: Spotify's Token-Gated Playlists a 'Powerful' Benefit for NFT Projects: Overlord Founder
entry.summary: Projects like Overlord and Kingship have joined Spotify’s new pilot, as the streaming music giant trials token-gated benefits for NFT owners.

entry.title: Coinbase Drops Free Ethereum NFT via Zora to Mark Base Network Launch
entry.summary: The free NFT has become Ethereum's biggest gas guzzler with 24,000+ editions minted, and flippers are already finding eager buyers.

entry.title: Optimism Pumps 16% Amid Coinbase Layer-2 Launch
entry.summary: Upon launching its own layer-2 solution, Coinbase said it would contribute to open-source development on the Optimism stack too.

entry.title: Crypto Trade Group Files Brief Urging Court to Dismiss Coinbase Insider Trading Case
entry.summary: The Chamber of Digital Commerce called the SEC's action against an ex-Coinbase employee a "stealth attempt" to expand the agency’s reach.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Hit With New Criminal Charges Over Political Donations
entry.summary: The FTX founder allegedly made illegal political donations, totaling tens of millions of dollars, a Thursday indictment shows.

entry.title: Web3 Social Startup Towns Raises $25.5M Led by Andreessen Horowitz
entry.summary: The forthcoming app aims to give users full control of their communities and private communications.

entry.title: DeGods and y00ts Are Leaving Solana—Here’s How It’s Going to Work
entry.summary: DeLabs details the motivations behind the Ethereum and Polygon moves and exclusively explains the bridging process for Decrypt.

entry.title: Coinbase Is Building Its Own Ethereum Layer-2 Network Called 'Base'
entry.summary: The company currently has no plans to release a token for its new L2, it says.

entry.title: Retro-Style Ethereum NFT Metaverse Game Worldwide Webb Raises $10M
entry.summary: It looks like a 16-bit game, but supports over a million NFT avatars, letting players pit Bored Apes against Cool Cats and plenty more.

entry.title: Liquidators to Sell ‘Certain’ NFTs From Bankrupt Three Arrows Capital
entry.summary: The now-defunct crypto fund Three Arrows Capital’s high-end Starry Night NFT fund won’t be included in this round of liquidations.

entry.title: Canadian Regulators Say No to Algorithmic Stablecoins
entry.summary: Fiat-backed stablecoins may get a pass, if their reserves are liquid and audited monthly.

entry.title: Polygon Block Explorer Crashes, Befuddles Users
entry.summary: Polygonscan crashed for several hours Wednesday, leading many to falsely believe the Polygon network itself had gone offline.

entry.title: Blur Founder 'Pacman' Revealed as 24-Year-Old High School, MIT Dropout
entry.summary: The Paradigm-backed NFT marketplace Blur has two founders, and one just doxxed himself after whispers of his identity swirled online.

entry.title: Rep. Tom Emmer Says Fed Must Not Create Digital Currency 'Surveillance State'
entry.summary: Emmer has introduced legislation that seeks to limit the Fed’s ability to issue a digital currency without additional oversight.

entry.title: Coinbase Not ‘Throwing in the Towel’ on NFT Marketplace Despite Weak Volume
entry.summary: Coinbase’s NFT marketplace has seen trading volume of less than 3 Ethereum in the past week.

entry.title: NBA Top Shot NFTs Are 'Plausibly' Securities, Judge Rules in Dapper Labs Lawsuit
entry.summary: A Dapper Labs lawsuit must move forward after a judge agrees with plaintiffs that NBA Top Shot NFTs appear to be unregistered securities.

entry.title: FTC Objects to Voyager Digital Restructuring Plan, Citing Ongoing Investigation
entry.summary: The FTC called language in the plan a "disguised discharge" to protect Voayger from being held accountable for "deceptive and unfair marketing."

entry.title: Binance Urges Industry-Wide Action to Boost Trust in Crypto
entry.summary: The crypto exchange’s global policy lead Rana Kortam discussed new measures taken by Binance—and why others should do the same.

entry.title: Uniswap Traders Can Now Buy NFTs With UNI, SHIB or Any Ethereum Token
entry.summary: Uniswap NFT is looking to out-engineer the competition by allowing traders to buy NFTs using any Ethereum-based token.

entry.title: Google Cloud Broadens Web3 Slate By Joining Tezos ‘Bakers’
entry.summary: The tech giant is already a validator for Solana and Aptos and now has a Web3 fan at the helm of YouTube.

entry.title: Building on Aptos? There's a New Web3 Accelerator for That
entry.summary: Participants will receive funding, support using Aptos’s Move programming language, and strategic advice on building their projects.

entry.title: SBF Legal Defense to Appoint Tech Expert as Court Mulls Amending Bail Conditions
entry.summary: Sam Bankman-Fried’s defense has agreed to cover costs for an independent technical expert advising the court on the FTX founder’s bail terms.

entry.title: Web3 a ‘Golden Opportunity’ for Hong Kong: Finance Secretary
entry.summary: Hong Kong's top finance minister pledged support for Web3, including fresh investment, as the city signals its reopening to the industry.

entry.title: Coinbase Says It Will Be 'Net Beneficiary' Amid Heightened Regulatory Scrutiny
entry.summary: With all eyes on crypto, Coinbase expects its strong foundation will make it “a net beneficiary of this new environment.”

entry.title: Crypto Labor Market Trends Don’t Echo Traditional Tech, Hiring Experts Say
entry.summary: From “quiet layoffs” to “wildcat firms,” the working class of Web3 is undergoing a major shift.

entry.title: Blur to Airdrop $300M In Extra Tokens to 'Loyal' NFT Traders
entry.summary: The upstart NFT marketplace, flying high after overtaking OpenSea, is pushing an aggressive incentives program to draw users.

entry.title: Bulgarian Investigators Claim 'Cryptoqueen' Was Murdered in 2018
entry.summary: The hunt for Ruja Ignatova may have already ended at the bottom of the Ionian Sea.

entry.title: Ubisoft Continues Web3 Push With Rabbids NFTs in The Sandbox
entry.summary: The Assassin’s Creed publisher is still building in Web3, adding Rabbids NFT avatars to its growing pile of crypto industry moves.

entry.title: Nearly $370 Billion in Bitcoin Has Gone 'Dormant'—Here’s Why
entry.summary: Investors are keeping their coins still, with the amount of Bitcoin not budging nearing a new all-time high.

entry.title: Solana Spaces Closing Stores in NYC and Miami
entry.summary: The team behind Solana Spaces shifts away from brick-and-mortar gateways to onboard people into Web3.

entry.title: Coinbase Reports Revenue Increase in Q4 Despite FTX Collapse
entry.summary: The leading crypto exchange in the U.S. reported sales that came in above analyst expectations.

entry.title: Crypto-Friendly Bank Silvergate Is Most Shorted Stock
entry.summary: Amid a regulatory crackdown on crypto, more traders are betting Silvergate’s stock will go down.

entry.title: Friendsies 'Rug Pull' NFT Holders—Could the Community Take Over?
entry.summary: Holders are calling Friendsies a “rug pull” after failing to deliver on promises—but some hope to pick up where FriendsWithYou left off.

entry.title: Fake Bing ChatGPT Tokens Pop Up Amid AI Hype
entry.summary: As AI excitement grows, a stream of malicious cryptocurrencies leveraging brand names has appeared on the market.

entry.title: gm: Ryan Wyatt on Polygon’s Winning Streak
entry.summary: Polygon Labs President Ryan Wyatt, the former YouTube Gaming head, helped turn Polygon into one of the crypto industry’s rare winners in 2022. In a lively chat with Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward, he revealed why the promise of digital ownership pushed him from the gaming world into crypto, and how Polygon has pulled giants like Starbucks, Reddit, and Instagram into Web3. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: NFT Paris Founder Alexandre Tsydenkov Previews 2023 Event
entry.summary: NFTs take over Paris on February 23. Decrypt's Stephen Graves interviews NFT Paris founder Alexandre Tsydenkov about this year's conference, which features speakers from many of the top collections and companies in the space, plus lots of side events. Decrypt will be on hand as a media partner, conducting interviews and moderating panels. See you in France!

entry.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner: Web3 Can Solve Twitch's Limitations
entry.summary: Paul Bettner tells Decrypt about the challenges he faced while developing his Web3 game "Wildcard."

entry.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner on Why He's Building His Next Game 'Wildcard' in Web3
entry.summary: Paul Bettner shares his perspective on Web3 gaming platforms and his vision to make games everywhere and anywhere players want them.

entry.title: gm Week in Review: SEC Targets Staking, a16z Doesn’t Get Its Way, NFTs Popping
entry.summary: In our February 11, 2023 week in review episode, Matthew Diemer, Stacy Elliott, and Stephen Graves talk about the latest developments in the FTX case, 3AC founders trying for a comeback, a16z losing on a big Uniswap vote despite holding 15 million UNI tokens, and NFTs roaring back with CryptoPunks, Bored Apes, and Ordinals NFTs selling hot. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Bill Murray Discusses NFT Project, First Members-Only Event
entry.summary: Comedic legend Bill Murray sits down with Decrypt at his first exclusive party for NFT holders in Oceanside, California. He describes the project’s origins and why it didn’t feel “mercenary” for him to create an NFT-based membership club.

entry.title: gm: Kristin Smith and the Crypto Crusade in Washington
entry.summary: Kristin Smith is Executive Director of the Blockchain Association, which advocates for crypto policy in Washington D.C.—an exhausting effort that Sam Bankman-Fried was closely involved in, until he set it all on fire. Kristin tells Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott how SBF and FTX set things back, but there are still positive signs from crypto friendly voices in Congress. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: gm: Week in Review: Tech Layoffs, Porsche NFTs, Ted Cruz
entry.summary: In our January 28, 2023 week in review episode, Dan Roberts, Matthew Diemer, and Kate Irwin talk about more layoffs in crypto and broader tech (including how Google botched its layoffs), the NFT market rebound and Porsche’s NFT drop (fail or surprise success?), Sam Bankman-Fried’s latest claims about FTX US and the surprising list of big companies on the FTX creditor list, and Ted Cruz’s weird effort to get DC vendors to accept Bitcoin. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: How Web3 Is Disrupting Video Streaming: Myco, Theta Labs, and Actor David Bianchi
entry.summary: At an investor event in L.A. hosted by watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Sander Lutz moderated a discussion about Film3 with Myco CCO Phil McKenzie, Theta Labs BD Head Andrea Berry, and actor and filmmaker David Bianchi, whose Web3 series "RZR" got funding through NFT drops.

entry.title: How Web3 and NFTs Are Disrupting Film: Myco, Livepeer, Ava Labs, Bad Grrls Creative Club
entry.summary: At an investor event in New York hosted by the watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Dan Roberts moderated a lively chat about Film3 with Phil McKenzie from Myco, Toni Thai Sterrett the founder of NFT member collective Bad Grrls Creative Club, Doug Petkanics the founder of decentralized video hosting platform Livepeer, and Daniel Killeen of Avalanche blockchain developer Ava Labs.
